response.answer_text: Intermolecular Forces are the forces which act at atomic level. These forces keep the molecules and atoms bound together. Without these forces no molecule would be possible. These Forces mediate interaction between molecules, including forces of attraction or repulsion which act between molecules and other types of neighboring particles, . E.g.- Atoms or ions. ... Ion-induced dipole forces. Ion-dipole forces. Hydrogen bonding. For details see ,Intermolecular force - Wikipedia    I hope you liked the answer.
